intro: Allantodia lobulosa var. shilinicola, commonly known as the Shilin rock orchid, is a rare and specialized plant native to the Shilin area of Taiwan. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, small, and often pale green or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is usually compact, with narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
